cves.shortDescription: RARLAB WinRAR contains an unspecified vulnerability that allows an attacker to execute code when a user attempts to view a benign file within a ZIP archive.
cves.requiredAction: Apply mitigations per vendor instructions or discontinue use of the product if mitigations are unavailable.

cves.vulnerabilityName: Microsoft Windows NTLMv2 Hash Disclosure Spoofing Vulnerability
cves.shortDescription: Microsoft Windows contains an NTLMv2 hash spoofing vulnerability that could result in disclosing a user's NTLMv2 hash to an attacker via a file open operation. The attacker could then leverage this hash to impersonate that user.
cves.requiredAction: Apply mitigations per vendor instructions or discontinue use of the product if mitigations are unavailable.

cves.vulnerabilityName: SAP NetWeaver Unrestricted File Upload Vulnerability
cves.shortDescription: SAP NetWeaver Visual Composer Metadata Uploader contains an unrestricted file upload vulnerability that allows an unauthenticated agent to upload potentially malicious executable binaries.
cves.requiredAction: Apply mitigations per vendor instructions, follow applicable BOD 22-01 guidance for cloud services, or discontinue use of the product if mitigations are unavailable.

cves.vulnerabilityName: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) OneView Code Injection Vulnerability
cves.shortDescription: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) OneView contains a code injection vulnerability that allows a remote unauthenticated user to perform remote code execution.
cves.requiredAction: Apply mitigations per vendor instructions, follow applicable BOD 22-01 guidance for cloud services, or discontinue use of the product if mitigations are unavailable.
